definitions.definition: have as belonging to one; own.
examples: I do not possess a television set

definitions.definition: have possession of as distinct from ownership.
examples: a two-year suspended sentence for possessing cocaine

definitions.definition: have as an ability, quality, or characteristic.
examples: he did not possess a sense of humor
synonyms: boast "he does not possess a sense of humor"

examples: all that the plaintiffs did was to possess themselves of the securities

definitions.definition: (of a demon or spirit, especially an evil one) have complete power over (someone) and be manifested through their speech or actions.
examples: she was possessed by the Devil
synonyms: under a spell "he was like a man possessed"

definitions.definition: (of an emotion, idea, etc.) dominate the mind of; have an overpowering influence on.
examples: I was possessed by a desire to tell her everything
synonyms: prey on someone's mind "she was possessed by a need to talk to him"

definitions.definition: maintain (oneself or one's mind or soul) in a state or condition of patience or quiet.
examples: I tried to possess my soul in patience and to forget how hungry I was
